comment.body:
Probably related to other similar issues where content script is injected to XHR, for example - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/CoreLibs/issues/1808 and https://github.com/AdguardTeam/CoreLibs/issues/1881

This rule:
```adblock
@@||m.sktuniverse.co.kr/html/template/*.html$xmlhttprequest,elemhide,jsinject,extension
```
seems to work fine on my end.

comment.body:
>just blank black

As far as I can see, currently it's the same without ad blocker.

>and the rule is also detected

They just simply download filter lists and display all rules which contains word `nontonx`.

>also here there are still NSFW videos

Without ad blocker there is no video player at all, but these rules:
```adblock
||nontonx.com^$replace=/if \(.\.. === null\) return;//,document
nontonx.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-replace-node-text', 'script', 'toString', '/if \(.\.. === null\) return;/g', '')
```
should fix it (though stream is offline).
